artist: Artist: Ross Braught; Author: Publius Ovidius Naso, called Ovid; Translator: Joseph Addison; Translator: John Dryden; Publisher: Ross Braught
description: Poem by Ovid, translated by Joseph Addison and John Dryden; original lithographs by Ros Braught. tan cover; thin book with poems printed in gray, and dark landscapes, some with figures; black slipcase with landscape on front
dimension: 14 1/8 x 11 1/4 x 3/4 in. (35.88 x 28.58 x 1.91 cm) (book only, closed)
image_copyright: Copyright of the artist%2C artist%27s estate%2C or assignees
provenance: Kathryn C. Johnson, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2004.
signed: on colophon page, in black ink: Ross Braught
text: The South Dakota Badlands and Grand Canyon inspired the look of Ross Braught's lithographic book Phaethon, based on the Roman poet Ovid's Metamorphoses. For Braught, mythic power lies in the landscape, where trees, waters and hills surge with the energy of the female form.
title: Phaethon
